<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public static void getTuples(List<String> l, int k) {
    int[] indices = new int[k];
    for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
        indices[i] = i;
    }
    while (indices[0] <= l.size() - k) {
        for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
            System.out.print(l.get(indices[i]));
        }
        System.out.println();
        int i;
        for (i = k - 1; i >= 0 && indices[i] == l.size() - k + i; i--);
        if (i >= 0) {
            indices[i]++;
            for (int j = i + 1; j < k; j++) {
                indices[j] = indices[i] + j - i;
            }
        } else {
            break;
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code generates all k-tuples of a list of n elements. It uses an array of indices to keep track of the current tuple. It starts with the first k elements and then iteratively moves the indices to the next tuple. When the last index reaches the end of the list, it moves the previous index one step forward and resets all following indices. This process continues until the first index has reached the position where there are just k elements left in the list.
